snippet: With Mets pitchers batting .000 this season, and with the Yankees and the Mets set to play each other four times this week, now is probably as good a time as any to revisit the legend of Dae-Sung Koo.
abstract: Keeping Score column recalls 400-foot double New York Mets former pitcher Dae-Sung Koo hit off of New York Yankees former pitcher Randy Johnson in 2005; says if Koo could get a hit off Johnson, maybe whoever is pitching for the Mets in upcoming Subway series will be lucky enough to get a hit off Yankees right-hander Masahiro Tanaka.
lead_paragraph: With Mets pitchers batting .000 this season, and with the Yankees and the Mets set to play each other four times this week, now is probably as good a time as any to revisit the legend of Dae-Sung Koo.

headline.main: Subway Series Offers Hope for Hitless Mets Pitchers
headline.print_headline: Subway Series Offers Hope for Hitless Mets Pitchers
